questions.question: What is the main risk when driving through road tunnels?

options.text: Driving at low-speeds, in a row of vehicles
Difficulty in adapting vision during entry and exit from such passages
The possibility of an uneven roadway.

questions.question: Using the service brake (hand brake) is indicated by:

options.text: Orange lights
Front and rear hazard warning (blinking) lights
Rear red lights.

questions.question: Where will you park your vehicle on meeting this indicator?

options.text: In the direction of the indicator, in specially designed lots for parking vehicles
On the sidewalk, perpendicular to it
On the sidewalk, parallel to it.

questions.question: What are the obligations of drivers?

options.text: To reduce speed when passing a traffic police officer in service, on the public highway
To keep the license plates clean and visible
To drive at speeds lesser than that prescribed by the minimum speed indicator.

questions.question: In which of the following situations is it forbidden to stop?

options.text: On road sectors not illuminated
At a distance of 5m from the rear of a tram
On European national roads.

questions.question: Where should drivers involved in car accidents go, to record their damages?

options.text: To the nearest police station, within 24 hours
At the county traffic police
At the police station, in the jurisdiction of their residence.

questions.question: What obligations do you have, if you encounter a police vehicle with blue warning signal lights and siren?

options.text: No obligation, because the blue signal is addressed to official vehicles
Stop as close as possible to the margin of the road
Reduce speed, ride as close to the kerb or margin and grant priority to the vehicle.

questions.question: Parking is allowed:

options.text: Only in specially designated places, indicated by signs or markings
On any public road, where stopping is not prohibited, provided it does not hinder the movement of other vehicles
Only on streets with a width of at least 6m.

questions.question: What measures should you take when driving in weather conditions that prevent good visibility?

options.text: Drive short distances with the position lights (parking lights) in operation
Use the position lights and drive closer to the right edge of the road
Use the low beam.

questions.question: What are your obligations if you are stopped by a policeman?

options.text: To remain in the vehicle, hands on the wheel and follow the indications of the policeman
To step out of the vehicle to show your driving license
To step out of the vehicle to enquire about the nature of offence you have committed.

questions.question: Can you change the position of the vehicle if you are involved in a car accident?

options.text: Yes, after you have administered first aid to the victims
Yes, after you have called the police
Yes, if the accident resulted only in damage.

questions.question: Are you required to submit biological samples, in case of a traffic accident that resulted in death or injury to people?

options.text: Yes, but only if you are guilty of causing the accident
No, if you have been tested with an authorized device
Yes.

questions.question: The driver is obliged:

options.text: Not to drive after consuming drugs (medicines) for chronic diseases
To be present in time, at the police station that summoned him to resolve any issues related to driving
To immediately notify the nearest police station if he got sick.

questions.question: It is prohibited for drivers:

options.text: To carry in, or, on the car, objects whose length or width exceeds, along with loads, the dimensions of the vehicle
To apply chemical treatments or foils on the windscreen, rear or side windows, that reduces visibility
To drive a damaged vehicle for more than 30 days.

questions.question: How does one ensure that there is no danger when reversing a car?

options.text: Switch on the rear fog lamp
Horn before reversing
Ensure from the front, rear and side.

questions.question: If a vehicle meets a column of many vehicles on a narrow public road, where traffic in both directions is impossible or dangerous, who will maneuver backwards:

options.text: The column of many vehicles
The vehicle
The drivers negotiate.

questions.question: Is it allowed to use fog lights at night, if the sky is clear?

options.text: The law does not specify
Yes
No.

questions.question: What obligation does a driver have if his vehicle is immobilized in an underground passage?

options.text: To switch off the engine and turn on the hazard warning (blinking) lights
To tow the vehicle up to the exit of the underground passage
To immediately notify the fire department of that area.

questions.question: What are the obligations when driving on roads covered with snow or ice?

options.text: Not to drive in such sectors without the authorization from the administration of roads
To drive a vehicle, whose total mass is more than 3.5 tons, only after mounting antiskid chains or other approved equipment on the wheels
Not to overtake.

questions.question: Wearing a seatbelt is mandatory when driving on roads outside towns?

options.text: Yes
No
The law does not provide an answer.

questions.question: Drivers can use their own means to detect devices that measure speed?

options.text: Yes
No
This is not legally established.

questions.question: When are you allowed to be aggressive while driving on public roads?

options.text: When the car in front is running at low speeds, without good reason
In no situation, no matter what happens to other road users
When the driver in the car in front is gesticulating obscenely.

questions.question: The voluntary stopping of vehicles is prohibited:

options.text: On one-way roads
In residential areas marked as such
Less than 25m before and after public transport stops.

questions.question: In which of the following situations is it forbidden to U-turn (turn)?

options.text: In curves with visibility reduced below 50 m
At meeting the indicator “Road with priority “
At meeting the indicator “Narrow road”.

questions.question: Before performing a U-turn on a road, you need to:

options.text: Signal and ensure from the front, back and side
Stop and signal the intention to turn
Ensure and move on the lane near the road axis.

questions.question: What is forbidden for drivers when travelling on public roads?

options.text: To carry more people than the number of seats in the certificate of incorporation or registration
To allow the inspection of the technical condition of the vehicle and goods transported
To open the doors when the car is parked.

questions.question: What are the obligations of a driver when traveling on a public road?

options.text: To drive only if the monthly medical check is made
To drive only on sections of the road that are allowed and to comply with the rules pertaining to maximum permissible total weight established by the competent authority
To be informed by road administrators, about minimum and maximum speed limits.

questions.question: In which of the following situations it is prohibited to stop vehicles on public roads?

options.text: In roundabouts
In the action area of the indicator “Prohibited Stationing (parking),”
On roads with a single direction of movement.

questions.question: You are prohibited from driving on public roads when:

options.text: The noise, while moving or stationary, exceeds the legally allowed limit
The mirrors are large
The sound warning device (horn) is not appropriate.

questions.question: While driving on public roads, the vehicle is more visible to other road users if:

options.text: It is adorned with stickers or colorful accessories fixed on the windshield and rear window
White or yellow paint is applied on the front and rear of the car
You clean the outside of the car, the number plates and lights.

questions.question: When it snows a lot, you will use:

options.text: The position (parking) lights
The horn
The low beam while driving.

questions.question: If you intend to carry a load using a personal vehicle, what should you consider?

options.text: The load can exceed by one meter, in front of the vehicle
That the load is not voluminous
It should not exceed the allowed length, width and weight.

questions.question: If a road is not lit, is it allowed to station (park) vehicles on the carriageway?

options.text: Yes, if the position (parking) lights are on
Yes, but only within localities
No.

questions.question: Drivers of vehicles are prohibited:

options.text: From uttering insults
From performing obscene gestures
From addressing other road users with offensive or vulgar language.

questions.question: Specify which vehicles are exempt from the obligation to grant priority to pass:

options.text: Vehicles that begin to move in the way of those already circulating
Public transport services, which are exiting stations provided with bays
Vehicles which exit yards, passages or garages.

questions.question: Drivers are prohibited while driving:

options.text: To smoke
To throw objects on public roads
To engage in discussions with other occupants of the vehicle.

questions.question: While driving, the driver is forbidden:

options.text: To smoke
To have interests that might distract his attention in a dangerous manner
To sound the horn.
